result.execSummary:
The defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Purchase Pseudoephedrine for Another with Intent/Facilitate Another Person's Manufacture of Meth, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.453(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
02:22 pm - Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in court with attorney Ryan Drengler.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Schiek/Drengler/Court statement to sentencing.  State will not rescind DPA in case 14cf86 at this time.  
Court Sentence
WHS/POP 30 Months  CC to probation currently serving
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights, NADVI given - Adjourned 02:38 p.m.

Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in court with attorney Ryan Drengler.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:30
Written waiver of prelim filed -   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.
Information not yet done but will mirror the amended complaint- Drengler willing to proceed - Will receive information - enters not guilty plea
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

02:34 pm - Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in court with attorney Ryan Drengler, appearing telephonically with leave of the court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived.
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 11:00 am.

no contact with anyone listed in the complaint, Michael J. Steinmetz, Jr., Jamie S. Rickert, Jesus M. Fernandez, Crystal S. Schirmacher, Jessica Steinmetz and/or William E. Campbell, if does not successfully complete treatment at Koinonia - report immediately to Oneida County jail and immediately notify PO - may not possess/obtain pseudoephedrine unless prescriped by medical provider.

03:20 pm - GBA for PFO - Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in court, via video, in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PD's office has not been able to appoint counsel as of today's date. Court adjourns.  Defendant/Bednar statement to bond modification - requesting signautre bond.  Court sets sig bond.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
no contact with anyone listed in the complaint, Michael J. Steinmetz, Jr., Jamie S. Rickert, Jesus M. Fernandez, Crystal S. Schirmacher, Jessica Steinmetz and/or William E. Campbell

01:36 pm - Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD.  Sciek will be amending the criminal complaint to remove the felony bail jumping charge from this complaint.  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
